subject: Re: JUnit 3 - compatibility - getName() method

Thanks for replies.

In fact, I used getName() to generate a kind of identi=
fier of which
tests have been executed, and so generate reports or stuff li=
ke that... 

If I well understand, there is no replacement for this method.=
.. I
feel amazing that 100% of previous functionalities are not supported :=
-(

I have to reinvent the well in order to my tests work as before...

Reg=
ards,
Anthony



--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Lee B" <leeb@...> wrote:
>
=
> I miss getName() as well. Here's what I use it for: I often have lots
> o=
f log4j logging messages that spew out of various places (test code
> and c=
ode-being-tested) and if a test fails while running from eclipse
> (say), t=
he logging can be quite revealing about where the bug is
> (without having =
to run the test again with the debugger, etc). With
> Junit3, I always over=
wrote setUp() and did a simple: 
> 
>   System.out.println("*** running tes=
t: " + this.getName());
> 
> so that I can easily find the logging messages=
 for that test in the
> sometimes rather lengthy log.
> 
> Lee
